be.title: Nodejs
be.summary: Node.js is a powerful tool for controlling servers, building web applications, and creating event-driven programs. And it takes JavaScript—a language familiar to all web developers—out of the browser. With Node.js, you can build applications that run on your laptop or even the cloud.

be.title: Expressjs
be.summary: Express is a fast, minimalist framework that sits on top of Node.js and allows you to build powerful single- and multi-page web applications and websites.

be.title: Socketio
be.summary: Socket.IO—a web library that enables real-time bidirectional event-based communication.
